nameEntry.part: Inquiry into the Implementation of the Recommendations of the Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Reports

biogHist.abstract: In September 2008, the Senate's Community Affairs Committee began an inquiry into the 'progress with the implementation of the recommendations in the reports by the Community Affairs References Committee, Lost Innocents: Righting the Record, a report on child migration tabled in August 2001, and Forgotten Australians, a report on Australians who experienced institutional or out-of-home care as children tabled in August 2004'. The committee's report, 'Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Revisited', was released in June 2009.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care (2003 - 2004)
Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse, Commonwealth Government (2012 - )

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Inquiry into the Implementation of the Recommendations of the Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Reports', in Find & Connect - Australia,
